sentences.english: The point of our pacification operations was always described as "winning the hearts and minds" of the people.
sentences.chinese: 我们绥靖行动的意义过去一贯被描写为“深得人心。”

sentences.english: The policy of pacificism is a catalyst to war.
sentences.chinese: 绥靖主义是战争的催化剂。

sentences.english: In the early period of the war, America adopted the policy of appeasement.
sentences.chinese: 战争初期，美国对日本采取了姑息与纵容的绥靖政策。

sentences.english: Today, it is Russia and China going hat in hand to the British-French-American victory celebration.
sentences.chinese: 今天，英法美绥靖的后果是俄罗斯和中国将步的后尘。

definition: Military Commission of the Communist Party Central Committee/same as 軍委|军委
Nationalist government 1920s-1949 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
to reorganize (troops etc) and discharge surplus personnel
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
to send armed forces to suppress
to enlist enemy or rebel soldiers by offering amnesty/to bring to negotiated surrender
old name for district of Hohhot city 呼和浩特[Hu1 he2 hao4 te4], Inner Mongolia
red bandit (i.e. PLA soldier (during the civil war) or Chinese communist (Tw))
